abstract.text: An interface to the PIV application on the YubiKey.

inlineContent.text: The PIVSession is an interface to the Personal Identity Verification (PIV) application on the YubiKey.
It supports importing, generating and using private keys. Reading and writing data objects such as
X.509 certificates and managing access (PIN, PUK, etc). Learn more about the PIV standard in the NIST SP 800-78

topicSections.title: Running commands in the PIV application

abstract.text: Delete key from slot. This method requires authentication with the management key.
A protocol defining a session with a specific application on the YubiKey.
Reads metadata about the private key stored in a slot.

Connect and run commands on the different applications on a YubiKey. The framework support connecting using NFC, Lightning and USB-C.

abstract.text: Reads metadata about the card management key
Move key from one slot to another. The source slot must not be the attestation slot and the
destination slot must be empty. This method requires authentication with the management key.
Reads the X.509 certificate stored in the specified slot on the YubiKey.
